114112111221.content:
You were immediately worried upon stepping inside. By now, you’d normally be getting slobbered all over, as that reliable canine of yours practically pounces on you and covers your face with doggy kisses. This time, however, the house was completely silent as you stepped in! That never happens! Even if she was sound asleep, the moment that front door opened, she would always jump from even the most restful of slumbers just to come greet you! The fact that the house was so ominous when you walked in this time seemed… ominous.

“Opal!” You tried calling out to her, your voice echoing down the halls. “C’mon out, girl!” Your voice fills the house… and yet, you still receive no answer. You strain your ears, but don’t hear the gentle tapping of paws that you had come to expect. Now you were getting REALLY worried! Did something happen to your beloved pet while you were gone? Did she get into some chocolate? Was she dognapped? A thousand possibilities ran through your mind as you began frantically searching the house, your panic slowly rising…

… you breathe out a sigh of relief when you find her, safe and sound, snoring as she slumbered peacefully. You were a little embarrassed it took you so long, considering she was right where you’d expect; her bed! Of course, that thought was quickly replaced with another realization… “W-whoa!” You gasped. “What did you eat, girl?” Your eyes drifted down to her fluffy tummy, which was now huge and round, almost as big as she was! It looked like she had stuffed herself full of every single thing in the pantry!

You step closer, your eyes wide in awe as you gaze at the sheer size of her gut. Your confusion only deepens when you see faint bulges, as if something was moving in there. She must be pregnant! But how could she have gotten THIS heavily pregnant over the course of a day? And just how many puppies were in there!? “What… on… Earth?” You said, stumbling forward. Whatever was in there, it must’ve put her into a DEEP slumber, since she was still soundly sleeping as you walked across the floor towards her.

Curiosity overwhelmed you, and you eventually took a knee and very gently laid a hand down on her round, fluffy, distended belly. Your heart leaps in your chest as you feel movement, almost as if you’ve woken something inside. Come to think of it… the shape and size of the bulge… it looked almost… human! It didn’t take long for you to hear a muffled voice coming from beneath those layers of pudge and fluff, confirming your very worst fears. “Jerry?” It was unmistakable. There was the voice of one of your closest friends... coming right from your dog’s stomach!

You let out a startled yelp, jumping back in surprise. You were wondering if this was all some sort of prank, some sort of special effects… but the clear imprint of a handprint in the side of her tummy made it very clear that there was, indeed, someone actually in there! “K-Kyle?” You stutter, stunned not only by the knowledge that it’s possible for dogs to swallow people, but also that your beloved pet would do such a terrible thing! “Oh my God! Are you… inside of there?”

“What does it look like?” He complains. He didn’t seem to be panicking as much as you, oddly. From his tone, he was treating this whole thing as some sort of inconvenience. “I’ve been stuck in here all day!”

“Oh, no! No, no, no, no!” You couldn’t let your dog… KILL somebody! You immediately started shaking the canine, trying to knock her from her slumber. Eventually, her beautiful yellow eyes slid gently open, and she gazed up at you, as if wondering why you were bothering her. You were given an ominous view of her massive maw as she let out a big yawn. “Opal! You gotta spit him out, girl! He’s my friend! You’re gonna… digest him!”

Before you could continue harassing her, though, Kyle moved around a bit inside, drawing your attention back to him. “Jerry, don’t worry about it! I’ve been in here for hours, and she hasn’t been digesting me at all,” he said, nonchalantly. “It’s actually… pretty comfy in here, now that I’ve gotten used to it…”

You were stunned! If you didn’t know better, it almost seemed like he LIKED it in there? Does he not know how incredibly dangerous this is? “Kyle, this is serious! How on Earth did you get in there!?”

“Well, I sorta locked myself out of my house, and it was sooo hot outside. I’m sorry, but… I sorta snuck in through your back door,” he explained, almost seeming a little embarrassed by the whole situation. “And then, Opal started lickin’ me, like always. But this time, I sorta… got curious what it was like in her mouth. I guess I took it a little too far, huh?”

“Ugh… so you crawled down my dog’s throat?” You asked, dumbstruck. Opal leaned forward to lick you a bit, but you immediately flinched away. “Opal, no! I don’t want any kisses right now!”

“Yeah! Pretty much. Well, more like I sorta stuck my feet in her mouth, and I guess she figured I was tryin’ to feed myself to her…” He said, starting to sound a little distressed. “Please don’t get mad at her! This is all my fault!”

Your panic was slowly deflated as you sat there, your mind racing to figure this whole thing out. “So… it’s safe in there?” You giggled a bit when you looked down at Opal’s smiling face, her tail wagging. You almost felt silly for being so panicked earlier. Of COURSE your beloved Opal would never digest your best friend! “Guess I should have figured. You’d never hurt anybody, would ya, girl?” You smile, leaning forward and playfully scratching the happy dog’s neck. A while later, though, another thought occured to you. “So how do you get out?”

“I have no idea! I’ve been trying to get her to spit me out, but she’s just been keeping me in here!” He complained. “Maybe she’ll listen to you?”

You sighed. You guess this is the moment of truth. Even though it was harmless in her stomach, if Opal tries to keep him trapped in there, she was going to have to have her stomach pumped, and then get some serious training to prevent her from tapping anybody in her tummy again. “Opal, I get that he’s tasty, but you gotta let him out, okay? You can’t keep him in there forever!” You start coaxing her as you gently rub her hand along her back. “C’mon, girl. Just spit him out. It’s okay…”

As always, she immediately understands what you’re trying to tell her, and quickly obeys. She stretches as she stands up, before looming over her bed and making some strange, hacking noises. Kyle let out a little groan as the dog’s stomach clamped down tightly around him, as he’s forced right back up that stretchy gullet. You stare in awe as an absolutely massive bulge travels up your dog’s throat, two feet eventually appearing at the back of her maw. Before too long, Kyle’s spat out onto the doggy bed, curled and shivering.

He was absolutely soaked from head to toe, as if he had just taken a bath in dog slobber… which, come to think of it, he basically has. The outside world was extremely bright and cool compared to Opal’s stomach, so he was stunned for a few seconds… but, before long, he looks up at you. “Do you… happen to have a chance of clothes?” He asked. “I think I’m gonna need a shower...”

***

Getting all the smelly, sticky dog slobber off of him took a while, but eventually, he emerged from the bathroom in a fresh pair of clothes, good as new. You glanced at eachother, awkwardly, this whole situation a little weird. “So… guess now I know what it’s like to be dog food,” he chuckled, nervously.

“Kyle! This is serious!” You crossed your arms, a little upset. “You can’t just go around feeding yourself to dogs! What if she digested you?”

“Hey! I didn’t MEAN to feed myself to her!” He defended himself. “And besides, you know Opal! She’s a total sweetheart. She’d never hurt anyone.”

You knew he was right, but you were still mad. “Well, it’s still a bad idea…”

“I’m not debating that,” he shook his head. “Now… I think I’m gonna get out of here before your parents get home. It might be a little… awkward to explain what I’ve been doing here.” With that, he made his way for the door. “Thanks for getting me out of there, Jerry! See ya later!”

Soon enough, he had gone home, and you sat there on the couch, petting the german shepherd curled up happily by your side. It was a little… weird being around her, now, knowing what she was capable of. She was a maneater… but was that really a bad thing? After all, she’d never hurt anybody. You didn’t know how to feel. “Oh, Opal. What am I going to do with you?” You sigh, overwhelmed by all this. In response, Opal just stirred a bit, her tail wagging happily before she curled back up.

Of course, this was not going to be the last of this sort of incident. As it turns out, something’s been awakened inside one of you...

124.content:
"Mr Stanley, Ms Ladrey." General Phillips said, guiding the newcomers inside the cordon and up the harsh side of the stony hill. "I believe you'll find everything in order. At present we're holding at seventy two percent, and the fissure is stable." The General paused, licking his lips. "I... ah... was under the impression that China was sending a representative?"

The American and European representatives looked oddly at each other. The tall, dark haired Brit coughed as he peered down at his diminutive, auburn haired compatriot from the states. She looked faintly Asian, despite her country of origin.

"There have been... complications." Ms Ladrey said. "I think China is still debating the Taiwan issue. Have the Russian and African representatives arrived already?"

The General nodded, escorting the two past the concrete barricades, the shouts of the demonstrators still echoing from half a mile away.

"At present things still seem to be steady on the main levels. Are we planning on leaving with only four of the five? I suppose we could simply transport more materials along with you?"

Mr Stanley shook his head. "I believe that is not an option." His crisp British accent still annoying his American counterpart. "Though as I understand it there is a Professor Poitier on the analysis team who has tested positive? Perhaps a second EU member?"

General Phillips shook his head, dreading the political fallout over this. Still, it was just the first jump. Hopefully China would get their things organized for the second. If they could keep it together that long... and assuming their theories on this were correct!

The three, with their black suited guards tagging along, finally crossed the dim concrete paved area, entering the huge building through a massive entryway, easily twenty foot tall. Inside was a large, single room, hanger-like in it's vast capacity, stretching hundreds of yards in either direction. In the center of this huge room was the point of this whole project. The rift. A twisted ribbon of purple and green energy knotted and twirled within a glowing sphere, needles of red energy coming from large mechanical devices arrayed around the contorting anomaly. a huge ramp lead up to the rift, with various equipment arrayed at the bottom of the ramp, waiting to ascend with the five travelers.

"Any clue yet from probes?" Ms Ladrey said in a hushed tone.

"Still no result from inorganic probes. There have been some success encasing devices in organic substrates, but so far nothing has returned. We believe there is some sort of EMP effect on electrical devices, even when the living tissue allows translation. I understand that yesterday they were able to get a mouse back however, unharmed."

"Really?" Mr Stanley said in a shocked tone. "I wasn't aware of that result. Why weren't we informed?"

"We've had a leak, and with the riots over the coastal flooding this project is looking more and more precarious. If they got a hint that this might be a way out we'd have a mob charging in to break in here. They wouldn't believe us that only a few can go as yet."

"Don't worry General. We'll open the rift further in time." Ms Ladrey said.

"Time, yes." Phillips said with a chuckle. "That is the crux of the matter isn't it?"

Mr Stanley clapped the man firmly on his shoulder.

"As my American associate has said General, they'll get it working right, and for now we just test the waters, eh?"

They stared ahead, at the natural tear in time, the one in a trillion event that the scientists had harnessed. The door that would eventually, hopefully, let them evacuate a dying world. That might lead them to...
124.title: The great experiment.

1242.content:
The scientists had determined that this tear in the fabric of reality lead 'next door', sidestepping time rather than going exactly forwards or backwards. This world would be like ours, but different. A slightly changed history somehow... though current indications were it's current date was slightly earlier than this universe.

"Ah, the rest of your team." The General said, meeting the others in their survival gear. "Ms Kiminova, Mr Chubuntu. I'm afraid the Chinese representative won't be joining us. Can you pass word to Mr Poitier to suit up and join us? I believe he's tested positive for the event?"

The other two team members nodded, a little confused at the change in plans, but African representative went over to a table and picked up a land-line phone and dialed.

"I see you're still not trusting cell phones?" Ms Ladrey said sharply, staring at the Russian.

"It's not that." Kiminova replied, surprisingly with barely a trace of an accent. "The rift is interfering with high frequency EM fields in the GHz range. We've had to adjust some of the control systems for the stabilizer beams as well. It was resonating with the electrical conduits."

"I see. So, we're still good to go?"

The team present went over to a table where several terminals were set up, the monitors flickering slightly, but working. Kiminova nodded to herself, smiling at the displays.

"We just started the initial surge. We're up to eighty three percent already. Less than a minute to breakthrough. This time with far more energy. This will work!"

The team attempted to not look too closely at the 'payload' that would be going with them. Five large cases had been coated in a resin, then algae grown on the outside in an effort to maintain cohesion crossing the rift. Still, no electronics could travel, just ordinary supplies. Maybe they'd fix that on later jumps.

A klaxon sounded, slowly winding up, then after a few seconds petering out. Lights flashed and the rift seemed to shimmer, then the twisting knot of energy, vibrating and blurring into a ball of light.

"OK people, you know what to do! Move it move it... Poitier! You with us? Come on!" The general shouted as the Frenchman ran up to the group as they ascended the ramp. "Good luck all of you. Send one of the small containers back with a report and we'll see how we're doing.

With some nervousness the five person team strode up the ramp, hauling the crates along on their wheeled pallets. One by one they vanished into the glare, and soon the ramp was empty.

The team nodded and they looked around. This was supposed to be an alternate timeline. Were things very different?

As Willow went into her home, Clarissa closed her blinds now that the scene was over. She had a normal family, Two older brothers that were in college and an adorable 8 year old sister. Her parents had jobs so she would babysit her younger sibling, Clara most of the time. But she would spend most of her time with Willow making sure Willow didn't suspect her of her fetish.

But for some strange reason, she too wanted to experience it. The fullness of life, the weight of responsibility. It was what fascinated her so. It was soon dark and Willow never came out of her home. Clarissa and Clara had dinner with her parents but all that was one Clarissa's mind was Willow's pregnancy.

"Oh how I wish I could feel what Willow feels." Clarissa thought as she drifted into a sleep.

Meanwhile, unknowingly to Clarissa, Willow knew Clarissa had a thing for pregnancy. Ever since her first surrogate pregnancy, she saw the eyes of curiosity from the start and always around her as she grew and gave birth. She only giggled at the girls antics but that's a young adolescent for you.

"It would be nice if someone could carry this load for a bit." Willow mumbled to herself as she brushed her hair in front of her mirror. She turned to Clarissa's room as the light turned off. Willow smiled as she slowly got up and stretched. She then waddled to her bed, scooted herself in.

"I think I just found the right person for the job." She said as she smiled and rubbed her belly."Maybe she could help the others as well."

choices: Following the underdog into the fray.
1353322221.content:
It had been sixteen years since our main character, Nate Joktan, had been born. Sixteen years of insignificance, hardship, and overall unluckiness. He had gotten the short stick in life, from his genetics, to his situation, things just piled on. He had a very childlike stature, about four inches less than five feet. Both his face and body structure were oddly feminine, yet boyish. And to add on to his childlike appearance he had a very shy, soft spoken, and overall submissive personality. He was a orphan, who managed to make his way to the top of the academic ladder to make up for everything he lacked.

         Finally on his sixteenth birthday he had finally had a breakthrough in his nightmare of a life, he had finally kissed a girl and managed to have a loving relationship with her. Let's follow our main character into his first major turning point in life, or would you rather meet another character who has a strange journey ahead of them.

choices: No, you already escaped once, why return?
13533222221.content:
Here we go again. Your mom was once again telling one of her friends about giving birth to you. "Yes, he was the biggest baby in the nursery, and boy, was my baby boy big. I knew before he was even out that he was going to be a big one because when he kicked, it was hard, and my belly was huge. And after hours of labor, I finally pushed him out, and when I saw him for the first time, I could tell he was larger than normal. But despite his larger size and the time it took for him to get squeezed out of me, I very much enjoyed my pregnancy. The way he kicked and moved inside me, and how wonderful it felt to be pregnant. I wish I could experience it all again, but I couldn't afford to have another baby. I wish there was a way to be pregnant with him again." As she continued talking to her friend, she was rubbing her stomach, perhaps trying to remember when she was pregnant...

After a while longer, she hung up with her friend and seemed to be still thinking of pregnancy as you walked into the kitchen. "I remember before you were even born, you were quite the active baby. You would move around inside me constantly, especially when I ate certain foods. Then late at night, we would play games, like I would poke one side of my belly and you would poke the same spot from the inside. Strange that you were born a large baby after all that activity. Took me hours to finally give birth to you, but I enjoyed every moment, from you first kick to when they cut the cord connecting you to me." She said as she continued to rub her stomach. "Yeah mom, you have told me a hundred times." You said. "I just wish I could experience it all again. Say, do you remember your time inside my womb?" "No, of course not. I was too young." "Now that's a shame. I wish you could experience and remember it so you could enjoy it as much as I did." "Yeah, if only I could return to your womb or you could restart your pregnancy with me, then we could both be happy." You say, then you walk out of the room. "Yeah, if only he could go back in the way he came out..."

The next day, you and your mom are having breakfast when she asks you a question. "Dear, what would you say if I knew a way for you to return to my womb and be my unborn baby again?"

Well, do you really want to become an unborn baby again?

Almost looks like a 3 month pregnant belly...And that is when it hits you. Her body must be preparing to be pregnant once more.
"I see you noticed my belly." She says. "Yeah. Are you...PREGNANT?" You ask. "Yes and no. See, the other day after you agreed to become my baby again, I had an experimental procedure done. All I had to do was give them a sample of your dna, then after they gave me a shot, they essentially started rewinding my pregnancy with you. After a total of 9 days, a day for each month of pregnancy, I will go into reverse labor, in which we will rush to the hospital, where you will be unborn. This method will allow you to see what my belly looked like when I was pregnant with you before, and what it was like when I finally went into labor." She explained. "So...in 6 days you're going to give reverse birth to me?" You ask. "Yes, some call it unbirth." "So that means in 7 days...I'm going to be inside your stomach, unborn, and you're going to be pregnant again?" You ask. "Yep. We're both going to get our wish." "Wow, I don't know what to say...." You say. You both know your silence is out of happiness, so you just ask to see her belly up close. She pulls up her shirt and you notice that her belly is quite swollen now, and definitely looks pregnant. You rub her belly gently, feeling the soft, roundness. Soon enough, you will be able to feel it from the inside...in six days...

144311.content:
You stare at the brilliantly blue sky and it's contrast to the vivid greens of the fields, or the dark browns and greens of the forest, or the cold colors of the rocky mountains, or the void of that hole... Your toes catch on a root and send you flying into a dark tunnel, and with a very girly yelp.

         You abruptly land on your back with a dull thud and somehow managed to avoid injury on your little 'trip', but something was off... This hole almost seemed inviting. The air was warm and had a faintly pleasant fragrance mixed into the earthy musk. You take another deep breath and feel around, the dirt floor is surprisingly flat and dry as a bone. You slowly move forward in the darkness, using the root encrusted wall to your right as a landmark.

         Suddenly your face meets a flat wooden object, making a loud knocking sound pierce the silent darkness and sends you onto your butt. You think it is a dead end until a soft, elegant voice calls from the other side of the door. "Um... Hello? Is someone there?"

         You sit there for a second, but are quick to realize that this may be someone who can help with your situation and reply to the voice. "Yes! But... Um... Actually I'm not sure." For a second there is a silence and you think that you'll be left in the dark, but you hear something click and the door creaks open about a inch, letting a flood of light poor onto you. You react by covering your eyes and blinking, then the voice asks. "Who are you? Wait, more importantly, why are you here?" The voice sounds a little more firm and clear than last time, but you can't really reply to either of those.

         After a second of thought, you unsurely reply. "Well... I'm not quite sure who I am, or why I'm here, but I fell down a hole and ended up at your door..." For a second the silence from earlier continues, but is broken by another question. "What do you mean, you don't know who you are? You lose your memory or some crap like that? If your looking for someone to listen to a sob story and throw you a pity party, then go the hell away." You manage to open your mouth before it is slammed into your face and the darkness engulfs you once more.

         You just sit there and stare at the darkness, unable to do anything about your current situation. You were cold, the pain and grumbling in your gut was getting worse, your mouth was dry, and you just felt like a hollow shell overall. Not to mention you felt really, really... really tired...
144311.title: Down the Rabbit Hole

145.content:
The air scraped past all the exposed skin on your body, leaving the sweat covering it conflicted. Whether it should turn to salty ice or stay a hot bodily fluid remained unclear, but you could care less. Only one thing was on your mind now, Run.

         The muscles in your body barely managed to continue, screaming for a break, but you couldn't stop... And the sound of crisp snow crunching behind you confirmed it. You had to run. What defense did you have? A tattered loin cloth? A twig in the snow? No. There was no such thing as "defense" for a simple, labor slave. Just fear and work.

         Even now as you run aimlessly through the wilderness, it was work. Work. What a strange word, especially when you can remember your early childhood. Images of mystic purple silk outlined by onyx colored metals. Weird contraptions filled with mystical fluids... Being babied by a loving family...A family...

         But what did you have now? Hell, you didn't even own yourself, your angered pursuers did. And what now? Would they catch you? Would they continue to own you like a sad animal? Or would they be fed up with the "thing" that tried to flee in fear and make you a merciless example... No. Not would or if, but could they? Could they catch you?
145.title: Fear

15311211122221.content:
You stood in an orange jumpsuit and shackles, amid a mass crowd of other prisoners. The room you had all been forced into was pitch black. Your legs were sore, but it was too crowded in the room to be able to sit down. Some of your fellow prisoners were groaning, nursing wounds they've acquired as a result of the guards pistol whipping them for walking too slowly.

The loudspeakers screeched as they blared to life. A light-hearted jingle played in the backgrounds as a passive aggressively cheery-sounding voice delivered the games instructions.

"W-w-w-welcome to the V&U Games, entertaining public audiences since 2037!

Your first challenge is the famous Labyrinth! I'm sure you know the drill, but I'll recount the rules for posterity's sake.

You will all be teleported to different edges of a massive labyrinth. The labyrinth is flooded with all kinds of animals, genetically modified to be able to devour you however they please. Your goal is to make to the center of the labyrinth to reach the next challenge.

Along the way, you'll find large doors embedded in the walls. They're locked from the outside, and if you choose to open them, there's a 50/50 chance of finding either a supply cache or a hungry animal lying in wait, so be careful.

With that out of the way, let the games begin!"

---

Suddenly, you were alone. The darkness was gone, and so was your shackles. You were standing in what appeared to be a maze, with wide hallways and walls that stretched up around 30 feet. You assumed you had been teleported to the 'labyrinth'.

You walked around, getting a feel for your surroundings. In the distance, you could already hear noises- the roar of an elephant, the roar of a lion, and the screams of the contestants who were unlucky enough to have been spawned right next to one of the animals. They all sounded relatively distant, though, so you felt comfortable progressing through the labyrinth.

Most of it seemed pretty linear, but after walking for a while, you find a diverging path. You hear what sounds like a silenced gunshot coming from the path to the left, while down the path to the right you heard what sounded like the combined howling of a pack of wolves.

You have to make a choice sometime. Which path do you choose?
15311211122221.title: The Labyrinth

153112111222211.content:
You decide to go down the left path.

You cross by a few supply caches along the way down the left path, but they'd already been looted. As you started to turn a corner, you suddenly caught your foot on something, and land flat on your face. You crawl back to your knees, wiping the dust from your eyes, only to realize you were kneeling right in front of a massive lion!

You yelped, jumping backwards in surprise. The lion was around 1.5x the size of a normal lion- a side-effect of the operations they do on the animals to give them the ability to swallow humans whole- and thus was 6 feet tall instead of the usual 4. You closed your eyes, bracing yourself, but to your surprise, it didn't immediately rip your throat out.

You looked at the lion again, and notice that it wasn't moving a muscle, except for its eyes. It must've been stunned! You remember now. The runners of this tournament didn't want any of their precious animals to get hurt, so instead of supplying real guns in supply caches, they provide stun guns that paralyze their targets for a short period of time.

You decided to get as far away from it as possible before its paralysis ends, and book it down the path, leaving the lion in the dust. After awhile, you notice another contestant, and immediately dive into a hiding place to watch from afar. She was wearing nothing but the standard-issue skin-tight grey jumpsuit, showing that she hadn't found armor yet, but she was holding a small, very valuable stun revolver.

She was coming in your direction, but she didn't notice you yet, so you figured you had two options. Either walk out the bushes and ask to join up with her, in the hopes of forming a group and at the risk of getting shot, or sneak up behind her and take her stun revolver by force, going off on your own. You ponder this for a moment.
153112111222211.title: The Left Path
